page.title: 11AIRDRIE POLICE STATION
page.content: THE POLICE STATION IN AIRDRIE WAS OPENED IN 1959.THE HEAD MAN IS CHIEF INSPECTOR LAIRD.COMPUTERS PLAY A LARGE PART IN POLICE WORK THERE.THE FIVE CARS,ONE VAN AND TWO UNMARKED C.I.D. CARS ARE HIGHLY MODERNISED WITH COMPUTER-AIDED RADIOS HAVING A RANGE OF 20 MILES.ALTHOUGH AIRDRIE HAS ITS OWN POLICE FORCE IT IS STILL PART OF THE LARGER STRATHCLYDE FORCE WHICH IS THE{LARGEST IN EUROPE. { }AIRDRIE'S MOST COMMON CRIMES ARE SHOPLIFTING AND CAR THEFT.DRUGS ARE NOT A MAIN PROBLEM HERE.TWENTY YEARS AGO BECAUSE THERE WERE NO LARGE STORES WITH OPEN DISPLAYS(A BLATANT TEMPTATION) THERE WERE VERY FEW SHOPLIFTING OFFENSES IN AIRDRIE.CRIMES IN THIS AREA IN GENERAL HAVE BECOME BIGGER AND MORE VIOLENT BUT THERE HAS BEEN NO USE OF FIRE ARMS.
